reviewText: "Brink is such a good movie. Not to mention it has great skating stunts! Eric Von Detten ("The Princess Diaries", "Leave It To Beaver") plays Andy Brinker, a 14 year old who, with his best friends, skates souley for the fun of it. But when his family needs money, he goes behind his friends back and joins their worst enemies, Team X-Blades. They are a sponserd team and Brink will get the money his family needs. When his friends find out, They ignore him. And the X-Blades aren't that friendly to him either! His whole world comes crashing down and he must find a way to get himself out of the mess he has created. You'll love Brink!
summary: Great Entertainment For The Whole Family!

reviewText: I love Disney Channel Original Movies! They are very good movies for the whole family! This one is about Andy Brinker. Him and his friends skate because it's fun! But there enimies skate for money! When Brink's family has money problems, He joins his enimies behind his friends backs to earn money! His friends find out and get mad. The tournament is coming up and Brink has to chose between skating with his friends, or earning alot of cash! This movie teaches kids about friendship and greed. Rent it today!
summary: A great made for t.v. movie!

reviewText: I believe that the song that was played when Andy went over to gabby's house was "give" by the suicide machines. Also, in that same movie, the Suicide Machines play the song "look before you leap" which is shown when Andy is doing a whole bunch of different things during the day and it shows a time period at the bottom of the screen. I believe it's also from the soundtrack "Battle Hymes" but I'm not 100% sure. You're best chance to find the song would be to look it up on limewire or something.Anyway, this is a great movie! I REALLY recommend it, even if you don't like skating, because it teaches the importance of friendship, and how it can be a lot greater than money. Overall, I'd give this movie a 6 out of 5 if I could.
summary: Well, to answer some of your questions...

reviewText: There is something about this movie that makes it very enjoable.  Maybe it's the funny parts where the "Soul Skaters" and "Sell-Outs" play pranks on each other, or maybe the director just purposely filmed it with that feel-good attitude to it.  Either way, I think girls and boys alike will enjoy this movie full of skating, friendship, and rivalry.  But I would recommend waiting for it to come on the Disney Channel before I would buy it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really mean it, too. I've seen a lot of the Disney Channel Original movies and enjoy all of them. In BRINK!, Andy Brinker (Erik Von Detten) and his friends rollerblade for the fun and enjoyment of doing it. When Andy's family starts to have money problems, Andy has to decide whether to dump his friends, or join a professional rollerblading team for the money. A great TV movie that tests one of the biggest problems and joys of all: Friendship. I really enjoyed watching this movie. Erik Von Detten is so cute and talented it's hard not to see this movie. BRINK! is a very delightful and entertaining TV movie for both kids and adults -- but mainly kids and teenagers will enjoy this movie, probably more than adults because kids and teeangers might understand it more. Totally recommend it. It's a must-see.
summary: Disney Channel makes some of the best TV movies!

reviewText: Honestly. This movie is so real and lifelike I could've written it. (But I didn't...:-p)Brink! is about Andy Brinker (aka Brink--played by Erik von Detten--:-D), a "soul skater" who skates with his best friends Peter (Patrick Levis), Gabby (Christina Vidal), and Jordy (Asher Gold). They all skate for fun, nothing more. However, they're having problems with their rivals, Team XBladz, whose leader Val Horrigan (Sam Horrigan) has it in for Brink. Their ongoing rivalry leads to a race in school, in which one of XBladz's members, Boomer, gets hurts and can't compete in the upcoming championship.Brink finds out that his family is having money problems, and when Val comes up to him and his friends and tells them the upsides of XBladz, Brink thinks that could be a great way to make money. So he joins the team, but his friends find out and hate him. So Brink has to figure out whether to stay true to his friends (and if they'll forgive him), or to stay on XBladz and help out his family.This is a great movie in many aspects. The skating scenes kick, and the music is excellent. That punk rock stuff is exactly what skaters listen to, so they got that right. And the same with the clothes. The acting is good, and the plot is mundane, but believable in that sense. Plus, Erik von Detten is a total cutie, and he lights up the screen. Christina Vidal is also great. Check this out, you'll like it.
Title: N/A
